tit.cmt: 他の記事に統一し、The削除、タイトルのため単語の頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 交野家（かたのけ）は桓武平氏高棟王流で、西洞院時慶（従二位・参議）（1552年 - 1640年）の末子交野時貞（大膳大夫）を祖とする堂上家。
sen.e: The Katano family, which claimed to be descended from Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) TAIRA no Takamune-o line, belonged to the Tosho Family (high rank court noble families); the founder of the family was Tokisada KATANO (Master of the Palace Table), who was the last son of Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Junior Second Rank, Councillor) (1552 - 1640).

The Katano family, which claimed to be descended from Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) TAIRA no Takamune-o line, belonged to the Tosho Family (high rank court noble families); the founder of the family was Tokisada KATANO (Master of the Palace Table), who was the last son of Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Junior Second Rank, Councillor) (1552 - 1640).

The Katano family, which claimed to be descended from Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) TAIRA no Takamune-o line, belonged to the Tosho-ke (the hereditary lineage of Court nobles occupying relatively high ranks); the founder of the family was Tokisada KATANO (Daizen no daibu, or Master of the Palace Table), who was the last son of Tokiyoshi NISHINOTOIN (Junii Sangi, or Junior Second Rank, Councilor) (1552 - 1640).
sen.cmt: 「堂上家」「従二位・参議」「大膳大夫」の表記を修正、米国スペルに統一するため、Councillor→Councilorとしました。(trans 1 comment参照)

sen.j: 後水尾天皇の側近だった西洞院時直（従二位・参議）（1584年 - 1636年）、平松時庸（ときつね）（従二位・権中納言）（1599年 - 1654年）及び、長谷家の祖長谷忠康（正三位・民部大輔）（1612年 - 1669年）はいずれも兄に当たる。
sen.e: Tokinao NISHINOTOIN (Junior Seond Rank, Councillor) (1584 -1636), who was a close retainer of Emperor Gomizunoo, Tokitsune HIRAMATSU (Junior Second Rank, Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) (1599 - 1654), and Tadayasu NAGATANI (Senior Third Rank, Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) (1612 -1669), who was the founder of the Nagatani family, were his brothers.

Tokinao NISHINOTOIN (Junior Seond Rank, Councillor) (1584 -1636), who was a close retainer of Emperor Gomizunoo, Tokitsune HIRAMATSU (Junior Second Rank, Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) (1599 - 1654), and Tadayasu NAGATANI (Senior Third Rank, Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) (1612 -1669), who was the founder of the Nagatani family, were his brothers.

Tokinao NISHINOTOIN (Junii Sangi) (1584 -1636), who was a close retainer of Emperor Gomizunoo, Tokitsune HIRAMATSU (Junii Gon Chunagon, or Junior Second Rank, Provisional Vice-Councilor of State) (1599 - 1654), and Tadayasu NAGATANI (Shosanmi Minbu taifu, or Senior Third Rank, Senior Assistant Minister of Popular Affairs) (1612 -1669), who was the founder of the Nagatani family, were his brothers.
sen.cmt: 「従二位・参議」→Junii Sangiとし、既出のため補足削除、「従二位・権中納言」「正三位・民部大輔」の表記を修正(trans 1 comment参照)

sen.j: 家格は名家 (公家)、従二位・参議を極官とする。
sen.e: The social standing of the family was Meika, upper rank of court nobles; the top rank the family could attiain was Junii Sangi (Junior Second Rank, Councillor).
The social standing of the family was Meika, upper rank of court nobles; the top rank the family could attiain was Junii Sangi (Junior Second Rank, Councillor).
The social standing of the family was Meika, upper rank of court nobles; the top rank the family could attiain was Junii Sangi.
sen.cmt: Junii Sangi →既出のため補足削除

sen.j: 江戸時代の家禄は30石3人扶持。
sen.e: The hereditary stipend was 30 koku, a ration for three persons in the Edo period.
The hereditary stipend was 30 koku, a ration for three persons in the Edo period.
The hereditary stipend was 30 koku, a ration for three persons in the Edo period.
The family had been given the title of viscount since the Meiji period.
The family had been given the title of viscount since the Meiji period.
The family had been given the title of viscount since the Meiji period.
